creator: Belegradek, Igor
Wei, Guofang
title: Metrics of positive Ricci curvature on bundles
description:
We construct new examples of manifolds of positive Ricci curvature which,
topologically, are vector bundles over compact manifolds of almost nonnegative
Ricci curvature. In particular, we prove that if E is the total space of a
vector bundle over a compact manifold of nonnegative Ricci curvature, then the
product of E and R^p admits a complete metric of positive Ricci curvature for
all large p.

title: Neutrosophic Logic - Generalization of the Intuitionistic Fuzzy Logic
description:
One generalizes the intuitionistic fuzzy logic (IFL) and other logics to
neutrosophic logic (NL). The distinctions between IFL and NL {and the
corresponding intuitionistic fuzzy set (IFS) and neutrosophic set (NS)
respectively} are presented.

Kapovitch, Vitali
title:
Classification of negatively pinched manifolds with amenable fundamental
  groups
description:
We give a diffeomorphism classification of pinched negatively curved
manifolds with amenable fundamental groups, namely, they are precisely the
M\"obius band, and the products of a line with the total spaces of flat vector
bundles over closed infranilmanifolds.
Comment: formula corrected, see page 24

subject: Mathematics - Differential Geometry

creator: Belegradek, Igor
Kapovitch, Vitali
title:
Pinching estimates for negatively curved manifolds with nilpotent
  fundamental groups
description:
Let $M$ be a complete Riemannian metric of sectional curvature within
$[-a^2,-1]$ whose fundamental group contains a $k$-step nilpotent subgroup of
finite index. We prove that $a\ge k$ answering a question of M. Gromov.
Furthermore, we show that for any $\epsilon>0$, the manifold $M$ admits a
complete Riemannian metric of sectional curvature within
$[-(k+\epsilon)^2,-1]$.
Comment: formula corrected, see page 7

subject: Mathematics - Logic
creator: Mijares, Jose
title: Parametrizing the abstract Ellentuck theorem
description:
We give a parametrization with perfect sets of the abstract Ellentuck
theorem. The main tool for achieving this goal is a sort of parametrization of
an abstract version of the Nash-Williams theorem. As corollaries, we obtain
some known classical results like the parametrized version of the Galvin-Prikry
theorem due to Miller and Todorcevic, and the parametrized version of
Ellentuck's theorem due to Pawlikowski. Also, we obtain parametized vesions of
nonclassical results such as Milliken's theorem.
Comment: 16 pages. Submitted to Elsevier's Discrete Mathematics

subject: Mathematics - Logic
identifier:
Mathematical Logic Quarterly Volume 53, Issue 3, pages 255-267,
  June 2007
creator: Mijares, Jose
title:
A notion of selective ultrafilter corresponding to topological Ramsey
  spaces
description:
We introduce the relation of "almost-reduction" in an arbitrary topological
Ramsey space R, as a generalization of the relation of "almost-inclusion" on
the space of infinite sets of natural numbers (the Ellentuck space). This leads
us to a type of ultrafilter U on the set of first approximations of the
elements of R which corresponds to the well-known notion of "selective
ultrafilter" on N, the set of natural numbers. The relationship turns out to be
rather exact in the sense that it permits us to lift several well-known facts
about selective ultrafilters on N and the Ellentuck space to the ultrafilter U
and the Ramsey space R. For example, we prove that the Open Coloring Axiom
holds in M[U], where M is a Solovay model. In this way we extend a result due
to Di Prisco and Todorcevic which gives the same conclusion for the Ellentuck
space.
Comment: 24 pages; submitted to Mathematical Logic Quarterly

title: Random sampling in chirp space
description:
For the space of functions that can be approximated by linear chirps, we
prove a reconstruction theorem by random sampling at arbitrary rates.
Comment: 12 pages

subject: Physics - Plasma Physics
Physics - Fluid Dynamics
creator: Ghendrih, Philippe
Lima, Ricardo
Mendes, R. Vilela
title: Reduction and approximation in gyrokinetics
description:
The gyrokinetics formulation of plasmas in strong magnetic fields aims at the
elimination of the angle associated with the Larmor rotation of charged
particles around the magnetic field lines. In a perturbative treatment or as a
time-averaging procedure, gyrokinetics is in general an approximation to the
true dynamics. Here we discuss the conditions under which gyrokinetics is
either an approximation or an exact operation in the framework of reduction of
dynamical systems with symmetry

subject: Quantum Physics
creator: Man'ko, M. A.
Man'ko, V. I.
Mendes, R. Vilela
title: A probabilistic operator symbol framework for quantum information
description:
Hilbert space operators may be mapped onto a space of ordinary functions
(operator symbols) equipped with an associative (but noncommutative)
star-product. A unified framework for such maps is reviewed. Because of its
clear probabilistic interpretation, a particular class of operator symbols
(tomograms) is proposed as a framework for quantum information problems. Qudit
states are identified with maps of the unitary group into the simplex. The
image of the unitary group on the simplex provides a geometrical
characterization of the nature of the quantum states. Generalized measurements,
typical quantum channels, entropies and entropy inequalities are discussed in
this setting.
Comment: 37 pages Latex, 3 figures
